content:
Diagnosis:
Malignant paraganglioma of right adrenal with local invasion
SDHC mutation positive
Dopamine-secreting

Previous management:
Diagnosis January 2024 following investigation of resistant hypertension
Initial alpha blockade with phenoxybenzamine commenced February 2024
Beta blockade added March 2024

Current situation:
Discussed at Combined Endocrine-Oncology MDT 15 April 2024

Imaging review:
CT 10 April 2024 shows 8.2cm right adrenal mass with invasion into posterior abdominal wall musculature and displacement of right kidney. No distant metastases identified. Single enlarged para-aortic lymph node measuring 1.8cm.

Biochemistry review:
Plasma metanephrines - normetanephrine 1250 pmol/L (elevated), metanephrine 380 pmol/L (normal)
Plasma dopamine significantly elevated at 850 pmol/L
24-hour urinary catecholamines confirm excess dopamine secretion

MDT Recommendations:
1. Not currently surgically resectable due to local invasion
2. Recommend 4 cycles of neoadjuvant CVD chemotherapy (cyclophosphamide, vincristine, dacarbazine)
3. Continue alpha blockade with phenoxybenzamine 10mg TDS
4. Continue beta blockade with propranolol 40mg BD
5. Weekly blood pressure monitoring
6. Genetic counselling referral for family screening given SDHC mutation
7. Re-imaging after cycle 2 and cycle 4 to assess response
8. Re-discussion at MDT after completion of neoadjuvant therapy

I have discussed these recommendations with [redacted name] today. She understands the rationale for neoadjuvant treatment and the importance of continuing alpha and beta blockade. She will commence chemotherapy next week following insertion of PICC line. Blood pressure currently stable at 125/75 on current blockade.
